## NormalizationResult interface

Result of the normalization operation.

**Signature:**

```typescript
export interface NormalizationResult 
```

## Remarks

This result object contains statistics about the normalization process and any errors that occurred. The function does not throw exceptions; all errors are captured in the `errors` array.

</th><th>

</th><th>

[errors](./declaration-file-normalizer.normalizationresult.errors.md)


</td><td>


</td><td>

Array&lt;{ file: string; error: string; }&gt;


</td><td>

Errors encountered during normalization. Each error includes the file path and error message. Empty array if normalization succeeded without errors.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[filesProcessed](./declaration-file-normalizer.normalizationresult.filesprocessed.md)


</td><td>


</td><td>

number


</td><td>

Total number of declaration files analyzed

<tr><td>

[modifiedFiles](./declaration-file-normalizer.normalizationresult.modifiedfiles.md)


</td><td>


</td><td>

string\[\]


</td><td>

Absolute paths of files that were modified. Empty array in dry-run mode or if no changes were needed.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[typesNormalized](./declaration-file-normalizer.normalizationresult.typesnormalized.md)


</td><td>


</td><td>

number


</td><td>

Number of composite types that required reordering. Zero if all types were already in sorted order.


</td></tr>
